Submodules

mymetal.io.vasp module

vasp module

This module provides functions for reading and writing VASP (Vienna Ab initio Simulation Package) input and output files. Taken from ase.io.vasp 3.22.1, but the ase version isn’t restricted to 3.22.1. I reviesd the my_write_vasp() function to add a lattice_scale_factor argument, and the my_read_vasp() function to return a additional lattice_constant argument.

Functions:

my_read_vasp: Reads a VASP file and returns its content. my_write_vasp: Writes data to a VASP file. read_vasp_list: Reads a list of VASP files and returns their contents.

mymetal.io.vasp.atomtypes_outpot(posfname, numsyms)

Try to retrieve chemical symbols from OUTCAR or POTCAR

If getting atomtypes from the first line in POSCAR/CONTCAR fails, it might be possible to find the data in OUTCAR or POTCAR, if these files exist.

posfname – The filename of the POSCAR/CONTCAR file we’re trying to read

numsyms – The number of symbols we must find

mymetal.io.vasp.get_atomtypes(fname)

Given a file name, get the atomic symbols.

The function can get this information from OUTCAR and POTCAR format files. The files can also be compressed with gzip or bzip2.

mymetal.io.vasp.get_atomtypes_from_formula(formula)

Return atom types from chemical formula (optionally prepended with and underscore).

mymetal.io.vasp.my_read_vasp(filename='CONTCAR') → Atoms

Import POSCAR/CONTCAR type file.

Reads unitcell, atom positions and constraints from the POSCAR/CONTCAR file and tries to read atom types from POSCAR/CONTCAR header, if this fails the atom types are read from OUTCAR or POTCAR file.

mymetal.io.vasp.my_write_vasp(filename, atoms, label=None, lattice_scale_factor=1, direct=True, sort=None, symbol_count=None, long_format=True, vasp5=True, ignore_constraints=False, wrap=True)

Method to write VASP position (POSCAR/CONTCAR) files.

Writes label, scalefactor, unitcell, # of various kinds of atoms, positions in cartesian or scaled coordinates (Direct), and constraints to file. Cartesian coordinates is default and default label is the atomic species, e.g. ‘C N H Cu’.

mymetal.io.vasp.read_vasp_list(filenames: list = None, format: str = None) → list

use my_read_vasp to read series of CONTCAR / POSCAR

Module contents

mymetal.io

This subpackage provides input and output utilities for interacting with VASP files and post-processing functions used in material simulations.

It includes functions for reading and writing VASP input/output files, as well as creating and writing content to files for post-processing tasks.

Modules:

  • vasp: Module for reading and writing VASP files.

  • post: Module for post-processing tasks.

mymetal.io.create_content(list=[], tag_split='   ', tag_end='', tag_begin='', left=True, num=10)

have a list of char, using myjust() to formatted them.

output a char to write in a specified file

mymetal.io.my_read_vasp(filename='CONTCAR') → Atoms

Import POSCAR/CONTCAR type file.

Reads unitcell, atom positions and constraints from the POSCAR/CONTCAR file and tries to read atom types from POSCAR/CONTCAR header, if this fails the atom types are read from OUTCAR or POTCAR file.

mymetal.io.my_write_vasp(filename, atoms, label=None, lattice_scale_factor=1, direct=True, sort=None, symbol_count=None, long_format=True, vasp5=True, ignore_constraints=False, wrap=True)

Method to write VASP position (POSCAR/CONTCAR) files.

Writes label, scalefactor, unitcell, # of various kinds of atoms, positions in cartesian or scaled coordinates (Direct), and constraints to file. Cartesian coordinates is default and default label is the atomic species, e.g. ‘C N H Cu’.

mymetal.io.read_vasp_list(filenames: list = None, format: str = None) → list

use my_read_vasp to read series of CONTCAR / POSCAR

mymetal.io.write_content_to_file(content_char, path, write_type='a')

write content_char to file controled by write_type.

for example, a-append, w-write overlap
